intro: Godetia epilobioides var. modesta, commonly known as the modest godetia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for rock gardens and wildflower displays.
